thing-type.label: ZEN30 Dimmer & Dry Contact Relay
thing-type.description: Dimmer &amp; Dry Contact Relay<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtFeatures</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtManual or Z-Wave control of 2 separate loads (dimmer + relay)</li&gt <li&gtPerfect replacement for a fan / light combo (neutral wire required)</li&gt <li&gtScene control for multi-tap scenarios on select hubs</li&gt <li&gtQuick and easy pigtail wire installation (single pole only)</li&gt <li&gt4-color LED indicator and air-gap switch for added safety</li&gt <li&gtPacked with advanced dimming features including ramp rate control, custom on brightness level, and double tap to full brightness</li&gt <li&gtRemembers and restores on/off status after power failure</li&gt <li&gtBuilt-in Z-Wave Plus signal repeater to extend network range</li&gt <li&gtS2 security protocol and 500 Z-Wave chip</li&gt </ul&gt<p&gtSpecifications</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtModel Number: ZEN30</li&gt <li&gtZ-Wave Signal Frequency: 908.42 MHz</li&gt <li&gtPower: 120 VAC, 60 Hz</li&gt <li&gtDimmer Max Load: 75 W LED, 250 W incandescent; DON’T use with tube lights, DC powered fixtures, or chandeliers</li&gt <li&gtRelay Max Load: 15 A (1/2 HP)</li&gt <li&gtOperating Temperature: 32-104° F (0-40° C)</li&gt <li&gtInstallation and Use: Indoor only</li&gt </ul&gt<p&gtScene Control</p&gt <p&gtYou can trigger up to 18 scenes or control up to 18 independent Z-Wave devices in your network using the Double Switch. You can assign scenes to 1-tap, 2-tap, 3-tap, 4-tap, 5-tap, or press-and-hold for any of the paddles and the relay button. Your hub needs to support central scene implementation for this feature to be available.</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<ol&gt<li&gtEnable Inclusion for the Z-Wave binding</li&gt <li&gtQuickly tap the upper paddle on the dimmer 3 times</li&gt <li&gtThe LED indicators will blink to signal communication and remain on for 2 seconds to confirm inclusion</li&gt </ol&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<ol&gt<li&gtEnable Exclusion for the Z-Wave binding</li&gt <li&gtBring your Z-Wave gateway (hub) close to the switch, if possible</li&gt <li&gtQuickly tap the lower paddle on the dimmer 3 times</li&gt </ol&gt

This setting is for the top status indicator only.</p&gt <p&gt6 x TAP UPPER PADDLE to change the LED mode.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_19_1
parameter.label: 19: Smart Bulb Setting
parameter.description: Enable/Disable Load Control for Dimmer<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt Enable or disable direct manual and Z-Wave control of the connected light. Works great for smart bulb control. If disabled, the dimmer will no longer control the connected bulb directly but will still send on/off and brightness reports to the hub so you can use them to create automations for your smart bulbs or other switches. Scenes and other functionality will still be available through paddles.</p&gt <p&gt4 TAP’N’HOLD LOWER PADDLE to change the mode.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_20_1
parameter.label: 20: Remote Control Setting
parameter.description: Enable/Disable Load Control for Relay<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtEnable or disable direct manual and Z-Wave control of the connected load. Works great for smart bulbs or any type of remote / scene control. If disabled, the relay will no longer control the connected load directly but will still send on/off reports to the hub so you can use them to create automations for your smart bulbs or other devices. Scenes and other functionality will still be available through the button.</p&gt <p&gt4 TAP’N’HOLD THE BUTTON to change the mode.</p&gt</p&gt
